head.supplied: 25/4/68 ¶ Honored and dear Sir. ¶ ¶ I feel very much indebted for your goodness of sending me the case with plants from Mr Walcott. It came here in a good state and the contents will form here a very...

div.p: Colonial Secretary's Office - letters received, acc. 36, vol. 610, f. 173, State Records Office of Western Australia, Perth.

I feel very much indebted for your goodness of sending me the case with plants from Mr Walcott. It came here in a good state and the contents will form here a very acceptable addition to the plants from W.A contained in our state-herbarium.

It is very pleasing to me to learn, that several West Australians are interesting themselves now for obtaining additional materials for my works. I hope I may live yet a few years to elucidate the flora of the country fully.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
Ferd von Mueller
On 6 May 1868 Barlee minuted: 'Keep with former letter from Dr. M. till I return to office F.P.B. 6.5.68'. See also M to F. Barlee, 8 April 1868.
